description: Cox's Bazar is a famous tourist destination in Bangladesh known for its long sandy sea beach. It stretches across 120 kilometers along the southeastern coastline of Bangladesh, making it the longest natural sea beach in the world.

The Sundarbans is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the largest mangrove forests in the world. It is home to the Bengal tiger and a diverse range of wildlife. Visitors can explore its unique ecosystem via boat tours.

Sreemangal is often referred to as the 'Tea Capital of Bangladesh.' It is renowned for its lush tea gardens, rolling hills, and serene landscapes. Visitors can explore the tea plantations and enjoy the tranquil environment.

Shajek Valley is a remote and picturesque destination in the Chittagong Hill Tracts. It is known for its lush green hills, winding rivers, and stunning landscapes. Shajek is a perfect place for nature lovers and adventure seekers.
